intro: Aconitum × dragulescuanum nothosubsp. dragulescuanum, commonly known as the hybrid aconite, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Ranunculaceae family. It is characterized by its tall, sparsely branched stems that can reach heights of up to 2 meters. The plant produces showy, blue to purple flowers in late summer, arranged in dense, conical clusters. Its leaves are palmately compound, with deeply lobed segments that are typically hairy. This nothosubspecies is a natural hybrid between Aconitum napellus and Aconitum carpathicum, exhibiting a mix of traits from both parent species.
